title: Static Analysis

android.permission.USE_BIOMETRIC.description: Allows an app to use device supported biometric modalities.

android.permission.CAMERA.description: Allows application to take pictures and videos with the camera. This allows the application to collect images that the camera is seeing at any time.

android.permission.ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE.description: Allows an application to view the status of all networks.

android.permission.ACCESS_WIFI_STATE.description: Allows an application to view the information about the status of Wi-Fi.

android.permission.USE_FINGERPRINT.description: This constant was deprecated in API level 28. Applications should request USE_BIOMETRIC instead

android.permission.INTERNET.description: Allows an application to create network sockets.

certificate_findings: Application is signed with a code signing certificate
Application is signed with v1 signature scheme, making it vulnerable to Janus vulnerability on Android <7.0

manifest_analysis.title:
Activity (vn.ncb.token.activities.DeeplinkActivity) is not Protected.
An intent-filter exists.
manifest_analysis.desc: An Activity is found to be shared with other apps on the device therefore leaving it accessible to any other application on the device. The presence of intent-filter indicates that the Activity is explicitly exported.
manifest_analysis.name: is not Protected.An intent-filter exists.

manifest_analysis.title: Launch Mode of Activity (vn.ncb.token.activities.MainActivity) is not standard.
manifest_analysis.desc: An Activity should not be having the launch mode attribute set to "singleTask/singleInstance" as it becomes root Activity and it is possible for other applications to read the contents of the calling Intent. So it is required to use the "standard" launch mode attribute when sensitive information is included in an Intent.
manifest_analysis.name: Launch Mode of Activity is not standard.

metadata.description: This App may request root (Super User) privileges.
The App logs information. Sensitive information should never be logged.
metadata.cwe: CWE-532 Insertion of Sensitive Information into Log File

metadata.description: This App may have root detection capabilities.
This App copies data to clipboard. Sensitive data should not be copied to clipboard as other applications can access it.

FCS_STO_EXT.1.1.choice: The application does not store any credentials to non-volatile memory.

FCS_CKM_EXT.1.1.choice: The application generate no asymmetric cryptographic keys.

FDP_DEC_EXT.1.1.choice: The application has access to ['camera', 'network connectivity'].

FDP_DEC_EXT.1.2.choice: The application has access to no sensitive information repositories.

FDP_NET_EXT.1.1.choice: The application has user/application initiated network communications.

FDP_DAR_EXT.1.1.choice: The application does not encrypt files in non-volatile memory.

FMT_MEC_EXT.1.1.choice: The application invoke the mechanisms recommended by the platform vendor for storing and setting configuration options.

FTP_DIT_EXT.1.1.choice: The application does encrypt some transmitted data with HTTPS/TLS/SSH between itself and another trusted IT product.

"term_content" : "Terms and Conditions for the registration and use of NCB Smart OTP authentication solution apply only to the customers who are using NCB e-Banking service with NCB Smart OTP application. These terms and conditions are an integral part of the Terms and Conditions of using NCB e-Banking services between NCB and Customers. Please read the following terms and conditions carefully before activating NCB Smart OTP application. When using any NCB e-Banking services with NCB Smart OTP application, the Customer is deemed to have read, accepted and agreed to these Terms and Conditions. NCB reserves the right to amend, supplement or remove any part of these terms and conditions at any time at NCB's sole discretion. Unless otherwise specified by NCB, the changes will take effect right from the time NCB uploads to main website www.ncb-bank.vn or other means according to NCB's notice from time to time without contacting the Customers.
Article 1: Key terms & concepts:
1. “NCB”: is the National Citizen Bank (including branches, transaction offices and other transaction channels of NCB).
2. “Customer”: is an individual or organization having a demand deposit account/ saving deposit/ loan/ cards and requests of NCB e-Banking service registration.
3. “Indivual Customers”: are Individual Customers who have current account/ saving deposit/ loan/ card and demanding to register for using NCB e-Banking service.
4. “Corporate Banking”: are organizations who have current accounts/ savings/ deposits/ loans and demanding to register for using NCB e-Banking service.
5. Electronic banking / e-Banking: e-Banking service provided by NCB to customers through Internet Banking, Mobile Banking. Customers log in with username and password registered at NCB to make online transactions.
6. NCB Smart OTP Application: The OTP code generating software built and managed by NCB, installed on mobile phones / tablets.
7. OTP code: A secret key code valid for one-time usage and valid for a certain period of time, generated from NCB Smart OTP Application. OTP code is one of the security factors for authenticating customers, customers' requests in e-banking transactions.
8. Phone number to register NCB Smart OTP application: The phone number registered to receive OTP that the Customer has registered with the Bank according to request for using e-banking service. For Corporate Customers, the phone number to register NCB Smart OTP application is the phone number of the Order creator / Order approver that the Customer has registered with NCB according to Request for using e-Banking service.
9. Request for using e-banking service: Documents for using e-Banking service signed between NCB and the Customer.
Article 2: Register, change NCB Smart OTP authentication solution
1. Conditions for registering to use NCB Smart OTP application: To use NCB Smart OTP application, customers need to meet the following conditions:
▪ Customers registered for e-Banking services according to the Request for using e-Banking services;
▪ Complete downloading NCB Smart OTP application to the phone / tablet that the Customer has registered with NCB; accept this Terms and Conditions; install and activate the application using the activation key sent by the NCB to the Customer's registered NCB Smart OTP application phone number; create PIN to access the application … Details of the installation and activation steps follow the instructions of NCB in each period of time.
▪ Agree and follow by this Terms, Conditions of Registration and Use of NCB Smart OTP Application.
▪ Other conditions followed by NCB's regulations in each period of time.
2. By downloading the NCB Smart OTP application, accepting the Terms and Conditions and activating the NCB Smart OTP application (activation code sent by the NCB to the registered phone number. NCB Smart OTP application of the Customer). Customer agrees to change the authentication method previously registered at NCB with NCB Smart OTP Authentication Solution.
3. Registration form, change of NCB Smart OTP authentication method: The registration and change of the NCB Smart OTP authentication method is done by the Customer in NCB's branches / transaction offices (for corporate customers) or through the NCB e-banking system or other forms as prescribed. NCB's regulations in each period of time.
Article 3: NCB Smart OTP authentication solution
Depending on each e-Banking transaction performed by the Customer, the NCB Smart OTP application will generate OTP basic code or advanced OTP code in order to match with the regulations on NCB Smart OTP application and the legal policies, including:
3.3. Basic OTP code:
▪ OTP code randomly generated in time synchronized with NCB's e-banking system;
▪ When performing e-Banking transactions, NCB's e-banking system requires customers to enter the basic type OTP code generated by NCB Smart OTP application to complete the transaction.
3.4. Advanced OTP code:
• OTP code generated in conjunction with the code of each transaction (also called the Challenge Code);
• When performing e-Banking transactions, NCB's e-Banking system creates a transaction code (Challenge Code) to notify the Customer. Customers enter / scan transaction codes to create advanced OTP codes;
• Customers enter an advanced OTP codes on NCB e-banking interface to complete their transactions.
Article 4: Customer rights and obligations
4.1. Customer rights
a. Having the right to register, use, change, terminate using NCB Smart OTP application; In case of changing or terminating using the NCB Smart OTP application, the Customer agrees that the Customer will not be able to perform e-banking transactions that require using the NCB Smart OTP application in accordance with NCB's regulations at the period of time;
b. Request NCB to re-issue activation code and PIN according to the methods prescribed by NCB at the period of time;
c. Having the right to be provided with NCB information, clearly and completely explaining information related to the use of NCB Smart OTP application;
d. Having the right to request NCB to guide, support during using NCB Smart OTP application;
e. Other rights in accordance with the Terms and Conditions and relevant provisions of law.
4.2. Customer Obligations
a. Commit to fully implement the regulations and processes on e-banking services prescribed by NCB when performing e-banking transactions; Comply with registration procedures, instructions related to NCB Smart OTP application of NCB;
b. Ensuring safety and security of activation codes, application access PINs and undertaking to take full responsibility when activation codes, customers' passwords are revealed, stolen, taken advantage of …;
c. Notify NCB immediately for instructions on handling if:
▪ Customers cannot access NCB Smart OTP applications or detect or suspect activation codes, PIN to access applications is exposed or their NCB Smart OTP applications are used by others.
▪ Customers discover any problems or technical problems related to the safety of NCB Smart OTP application.
▪ Other obligations under these Terms and Conditions and the Request for using e-banking services.
Article 5: NCB rights and obligations
5.1. NCB rights
a. Request Customers provide personal / organization information, identification documents, and other relevant documents … when the Customer makes requests related to NCB Smart OTP application;
b. In case Customer fails to access NCB Smart OTP application 05 times via PIN, NCB will lock access to the application until Customer completes procedures to reactivate the application following NCB's regulations at the period of time;
c. Not responsible for any problems caused by the Customer disclosing activation codes, PIN accessing the application for any reason;
d. Not responsible if Customer uses software, data or follows instructions related to NCB Smart OTP application not provided by NCB;
e. Other obligation under these Terms, Conditions and Request for using e-Banking services.
5.2. NCB obligations
a. Provide information, explain clearly and fully information relating to the use of NCB Smart OTP application to the Customer;
b. Re-issue activation code, PIN code at the request of the Customer in case the Customer meets the conditions prescribed by NCB from time to time;
c. Resolve customer inquiries and complaints related to the use of NCB Smart OTP application in accordance with NCB's regulations at the period of time;
d. Other obligations under these Terms, Conditions and Request for using e-banking services.
Article 6: Other terms
1. Customer agrees that NCB reserves the right to amend and supplement the content of these Terms and Conditions on the basis of ensuring the amendment and supplement in accordance with the relevant provisions of law. NCB will notify Customer of the amendment and supplement of these Terms and Conditions and product and program information related to NCB Smart OTP application (if any) by but not limited to one of the following: via document, email, SMS, posting at NCB branches / offices or on the mass media or on NCB's official website. Customer is considered to accept all amendments according to NCB's notice if Customer continues to use the service after NCB's notice.
2. The provisions of these Terms and Conditions are effective from the date of application as stated at the beginning of these Terms and Conditions. From the effective date, these terms and conditions apply to all Customers using NCB Smart OTP application.
3. Customer confirms that they have read, understood and committed to comply with these terms and conditions, other NCB's regulations related to NCB Smart OTP application and current relevant legal policies.
4. Other contents that have not been mentioned in the Terms and Conditions, this provision shall comply with the provisions of the Request for using e-banking service signed between NCB and the Customer following relevant legal policies.
"

playstore_details.title: NCB Smart OTP
playstore_details.description:
"NCB Smart OTP là ứng dụng được phát triển bởi Ngân hàng TMCP Quốc Dân (NCB), được cài đặt trên thiết bị di động để tạo mật khẩu thông minh sử dụng một lần (Smart OTP), an toàn và bảo mật hơn khi thực hiện giao dịch trên ngân hàng trực tuyến (internet banking & NCB iziMobile).
Các tính năng nổi bật:
•           Tăng tính bảo mật bằng việc mã hóa Smart OTP tới thiết bị
•           Tiện lợi, không phải mang theo thiết bị bảo mật (hard token)
•           Ổn định, không cần kết nối Internet, không cần roaming khi đi nước ngoài
•           Đăng ký dễ dàng trên internet banking/NCB iziMobile
•           Đăng nhập dễ dàng bằng Vân tay/Face ID/PIN
•           Đáp ứng hạn mức giao dịch loại D (loại cao nhất) theo yêu cầu của NHNN
Để biết thêm thông tin chi tiết, vui lòng gọi Hotline: 18006166, Email: Callcenter@ncb-bank.vn.
playstore_details.developerAddress: Số 28C - 28D phố Bà Triệu, Phường Hàng Bài, Quận Hoàn Kiếm, Thanh phố Hà Nội, Việt Nam
